Text:
I’m glad to see @FLOTUS in San Antonio speaking w/residents & military families about the challenges our Latino community faces when it comes to cancer.

I look forward to working w/the Biden admin to invest in research that improves Texans' lives & ends cancer as we know it. https://t.co/FaA5T2FSie

My top priority is making sure San Antonians are up to date on the services my office offers, federal resources available, and the latest news affecting our district.

Sign up for my newsletter👇
https://t.co/UHNRwiEUa9

Texas has one of the highest pandemic death tolls in the nation. If your family is struggling w/ funeral costs after losing a loved one to #COVID19, help is within reach. To date, Texans have received over $176M in @FEMA funeral aid. Learn about applying: https://t.co/T4RkigLGpn

For-profit colleges that lie & misrepresent graduates’ job placement rates must be held accountable. 

San Antonians who attended DeVry University may be eligible to receive a 100% loan repayment by submitting a borrower defense claim.

Apply here: https://t.co/3hdxIHFCtj

Important news for student loan borrowers: The Biden admin. is erasing $31M in student debt for Texans who were victimized by for-profit colleges, including DeVry.

These schools scammed students who were trying to build a better life. Glad to see justice, finally. (1/2) https://t.co/1dCPgcS6DH

Let's be clear on what happened here:

First, @DanPatrick knowingly told voters the wrong address to apply for mail-in ballots.

Then, TX's SoS broke their own policy to accommodate him.

Now, more Texans will be unable to vote by mail because TX GOP leaders failed them again. https://t.co/VBh9u3eOfa

The WWII internment of Japanese, Italian & German Americans marked a dark chapter in our history.
 
On National Day of Remembrance, we honor and recognize those who suffered and continue working toward a just future where all people are treated with the respect they deserve.

After saving 1200+ lives during the Rwandan genocide, Paul Rusesabagina moved to San Antonio and held Rwanda's government accountable for despotism.

Now, he's a political prisoner.

In today's @ExpressNews, I urge Rwanda to #FreeRusesabagina. 

READ 👇
https://t.co/eBwHrPJqCX

In 2021 alone, Democratic economic policies created 37,600 manufacturing jobs in Texas.
 
(That’s nearly 3X the jobs created in 2019 under Trump)
 
Folks, the #AmericanRescuePlan is working & we are building off that momentum to create good jobs & a strong economy for TX workers. https://t.co/jYf0KQ1Ygl

Asylum is a human right.

Under Title 42, the U.S. is expelling thousands of asylum seekers fleeing war, violence & climate catastrophe in their home countries.

I joined over 100 of my colleagues to urge the Biden Admin to end Title 42 and protect migrants. https://t.co/cJqIKIv4P5

I’m pleased to see the DeLorean Motor Company establishing its headquarters at @PortSanAntonio. 

This is a major win that will strengthen the economy, create 450 jobs, and reaffirm San Antonio’s status as an advantageous region for vehicle manufacturing. https://t.co/gx2n7KY8z6

Replacement theory, invasion rhetoric has gotten people killed. That’s what happened in El Paso in 2019. Yet Texas Republicans are shamelessly scapegoating immigrants. It makes American society more dangerous for historically-targeted groups — Latinos, blacks, Jews, Muslims. https://t.co/td9nnuIQ4m

The UN and our own former @StateDept advisors agree that our continued use of Title 42 is wrong. 

During this week's @HouseForeign hearing, I pressed @State_IO on our responsibility to make sure migrants & asylum-seekers are treated fairly under international law. https://t.co/1JIVHQcUeP

Thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law I voted to pass, Texas communities will receive more than $60 million this year to build convenient, reliable, and affordable electric vehicle charging infrastructure and create good-paying jobs. #ElectrifyingAmerica https://t.co/08hspdJ6tk
This truly represents a breakdown in the American public education system (at least in one state). https://t.co/ieYCZkrrhl

This hearing will examine what changes need to be made to keep international orgs relevant & effective. I congratulate our witness, @State_IO on her confirmation and look forward to our continued work with her bureau to address policy and management challenges. (6/6)

Recently, Congress has made significant progress to strengthen our global leadership – and I am grateful to the State Department Bureau of International Organization Affairs for the assistance they provided with the COMPETES Act to support US participation w/the @UN. (5/6)

Whether it’s a worldwide pandemic, or armies massing on international borders with threats of invasion, we are facing old challenges in a new guise. 
 
Right now, Russia’s military buildup and potential invasion of Ukraine is a pressing challenge to our postwar order. (4/6)

More than 75 years after the signing of the @UN Charter, we see signs of a need to strengthen international organizations to respond to new threats. 

Challenges like climate change & climate-driven migration have major impacts on geopolitics & how we live our lives. (3/6)

The United Nations has kept the peace between major powers for decades and plays a critical role in peacekeeping around the world. The established system of international organizations, including the @UN, has advanced our technical & humanitarian cooperation in many areas. (2/6)

Tune in: I’m convening a @HouseForeign subcommittee hearing to mark America’s renewed engagement with international organizations and signal renewed cooperation between the @StateDept and Congress on this issue.
 
WATCH: https://t.co/GptAugSXCw (1/6)

Today, I’m leading a @HouseForeign subcommittee hearing on the State Department’s approach to reestablish key relationships with international organizations.

We’ll hear from Assistant Secretary Michele Sison.

Tune in at 2pm ET: https://t.co/TIKWf3jFtf https://t.co/zDeG86NiBg

Even as Russia appears on the brink of invading Ukraine, President Bolsonaro is visiting to deepen Brazil’s ties and become closer with Putin.

The Trump admin designated Brazil a “major non-NATO ally,” but they’re hardly acting like one. https://t.co/YuqmCm2wQU

Early voting for the Texas primary election started today & runs until February 25th — except for Presidents’ Day (2/21). 

Bexar County voters can cast a ballot at any polling place within the county. 

For hours, locations, what to bring & eligibility👇
https://t.co/gdRhRgFeOW

Domestic violence is not acceptable in San Antonio or any community. 

I joined the @DV_Commission to provide an update on efforts I’ve taken in Congress to connect our city with federal resources to support survivors & hold abusers accountable. https://t.co/AzyMLMzGuJ

As the situation in Ukraine develops, my priority is the safety of Americans on the ground.

The State Department urges all Americans in Ukraine to leave the country immediately. For more information and to register for @StateDept alerts, click here: https://t.co/8OOJc2QL2F https://t.co/sVeXuqRYM1

Thousands of immigrant children & families were cruelly separated under Trump’s zero-tolerance policy, causing immense pain and trauma.

My bill with @SenBlumenthal will help these families safely reunite in the U.S. and provide a pathway to citizenship. 
https://t.co/oWe4Yjp104

The internet is vital for work, school, healthcare & more. 

Yet nearly 20% of Bexar County households are without it. 

Through the Infrastructure Law, I voted to secure $14.2B to lower the cost of internet service. Learn how this can help you: https://t.co/IntRtAvE9N

As San Antonio grows, we need to expand public transit to relieve congestion & help our city grow.
 
@USDOT announced that San Antonio will receive $12.7 million in VIA funding that I voted for – with more on the way to create good jobs and expand opportunity for all.

Adding to a string of excellent foreign affairs confirmations — congratulations to @sashanbaker! Sasha is one of our nation’s finest foreign policy thinkers and her continued service at the Pentagon will help us lead with compassion and strength on the world stage. https://t.co/P8TwABjYmQ

The fight for equality can't stop at our nation’s borders. 

I voted for and the House passed the #GlobalRespectAct to deny visas to those who commit human rights abuses against the LGBTQ+ community.

Acts of violence will not be tolerated at home or abroad. https://t.co/UhcIz0FGxB

Congratulations to Scott Nathan on his successful confirmation as CEO of @DFCgov! His deep experience in strategic investment and global affairs will be a tremendous asset as DFC works to strengthen U.S. leadership and support development in places with the greatest need. https://t.co/JSV7gKFjqd

Abandoning our veterans is unconscionable.
 
I’m leading an amicus brief to SCOTUS to support @trooper1999’s lawsuit & defend veterans' rights to return to their civilian jobs.
 
TX veterans fought for us & it’s an honor to fight for them. (3/3)
https://t.co/hMe3JFeY8j

Captain Torres's exposure to toxic burn pits gave him a devastating lung disease that makes it hard to breathe.
 
He asked @TxDPS to reassign him to a desk job. Instead, they forced him to resign — and then the state rejected his disability claim. (2/3)
https://t.co/gxXCIAsPrX

Captain Le Roy Torres had been a member of the U.S. Army Reserves for 18 years when he was deployed to Iraq in 2007 to serve our nation.
 
After serving bravely, he was honorably discharged and tried to return to work as a Texas state trooper. (1/3)

The @USPS delivers life-saving medications, urgent packages & more to Texas and across the country. Yet its financial condition has deteriorated over the past decade. 

I voted to pass the #PostalServiceReformAct, ensuring the Postal Service continues its work for years to come. https://t.co/XJcxLHKYDp

Congratulations to Chantale Yokmin Wong on her history-making confirmation!
 
Ambassador Wong is an exceptional leader & her prior experience with ADB will help her hit the ground running in her new role. I look forward to working with her to advance our global development goals. https://t.co/opD1jeN3a3

This is what a hero looks like.
 
28 years ago, Paul Rusesabagina saved 1200+ lives during the Rwandan genocide.
 
In 2020, Rwanda imprisoned him on politically motivated charges. Today, @HouseForeign passed my resolution w/@RepYoungKim demanding that Rwanda #FreeRusesabagina. https://t.co/xqN9ylTxrT

San Antonio is home to many Cameroonian-Americans. Today, @HouseForeign will mark up a resolution I cosponsored to condemn the Cameroonian government for abuses committed in the Anglophone region and urge them to work with local leaders to address grievances and end violence. 2/2

Today, @HouseForeign will debate my resolution w @RepYoungKim calling on Rwanda to #FreeRusesabagina — a US resident & hero who saved countless lives during the Rwandan genocide. We will not stop pressing this issue until Paul Rusesabagina returns to his family in San Antonio. 1/

🚨 SAN ANTONIO 🚨

My San Antonio office is currently unable to answer phone calls due to a building-wide outage. While we quickly work to resolve the issue, I urge any district residents in need of assistance to contact my DC office at (202) 225-3236.

I’ll be joining @JDBalartMSNBC soon to discuss the Remain in Mexico program and the Russia-Ukraine conflict. 

Tune in at 10:45 am ET / 9:45 am CT. https://t.co/XNQRkM6YC8

Want to speed up the process? File electronically as early as possible & opt for direct deposit.

Need help filing? Use the free IRS Volunteer Income Tax Assistance tool. 

More info on how to file ⤵️

Over the past two years alone, Congressional staff have kept our government running through an insurrection and a global pandemic. If our hard-working staff choose to unionize, they have my full support. #UnionStrong

Congratulations to @Jorge_Zamanillo on being named its first director! https://t.co/fzcXO1VYr8

I hope both the Cuban government and the Biden administration can recognize the potential benefits of re-engagement policies.

It is time we review U.S. policies toward Cuba to ensure tangible economic and social improvements for the Cuban people. 3/3

.@WHAAsstSecty recognized specific steps that the Cuban government can take to bring the United States back to a policy of engagement, including a halt to mass trials of the July protestors & the release of minors in custody. 

I urge the Cuban government to take such actions. 2/ https://t.co/r8IeQc8OuE

Current U.S. restrictions on visas, travel, and remittances prevent thousands of Cuban Americans from supporting their families still in Cuba.

During today’s @HouseForeign hearing, I asked @WHAAsstSecty what actions the State Department is taking to address these issues 1/ https://t.co/nvi1arB4Ph

Thanks to our brave military forces, the leader of ISIS was successfully removed. While the fight against terrorism continues, this reiterates the United States’ commitment to protecting the American people & our allies from threats. 

I commend President Biden on his leadership. https://t.co/m7qcfhQdIL

I hope the @NFL investigates these claims and holds people accountable. If not, Congress and the Department of Justice @DOJPH should.  Paying — or offering to pay — money to a coach to lose games amounts to fraud, game-rigging, etc. https://t.co/zYMyWzp0c0
Happy 6th Birthday to my son, Roman Victor Castro! https://t.co/UbQnRnv8in
I’d feel a lot better about this winter storm about to hit Texas if Greg Abbott wasn’t Governor.

San Antonians, please take proper precautions ahead of the anticipated arctic blast.

Dress in layers, bring pets inside & cover plants and outdoor pipes. 

311 is extending customer service hours.

Bexar County will open six warming sites today from 7 pm to 12 pm on Saturday. 👇 https://t.co/C3xvnb8Fwb

I look forward to working with @StateDept & @USAID and cooperating more with civil society on development efforts in Honduras, El Salvador, and Guatemala.

I also welcome the opportunity to engage with these governments on how they can support the crucial work of local orgs.

Local organizations are critical to hold governments accountable & support inclusive development.

Today, @NormaJTorres, @SenatorMarkey, @RepMcGovern & I urged @StateDept & @USAID to prioritize protection of civil society in the Northern Triangle. (2/3) 
https://t.co/vX0CPjjlSf

As our hemisphere tackles threats to democracy & increased migration, the U.S. must work with local partners on sustainable solutions.

However, civil society in the Northern Triangle faces a difficult environment, including new & restrictive laws in Guatemala & El Salvador (1/3)

Paul Rusesabagina saved thousands of lives during the 1994 Rwandan genocide. 

He’s been unfairly targeted and imprisoned for opposing the Republic of Rwanda.

My resolution with @RepYoungKim urges for his immediate release and return home to San Antonio.

This Holocaust Remembrance Day, we mourn the loss of 6 million Jews during one of the darkest periods in history.

Today and every day, we must commit to speaking out against and ending all forms of violence, hatred, and anti-Semitism.

Never forget. Never again.

A strong economy needs a strong workforce.

Included in the America COMPETES Act is mine and @RepSpanberger’s, ‘Strengthening Youth Apprenticeships Act,’ which directs @USDOL & @usedgov to collaborate & create public guidance for earning college credit with an apprenticeship. 8/8

The America COMPETES Act also includes a critical provision to reform how @DFCgov equity investments for projects abroad are treated.

This legislation would allow the United States to better invest in high-quality development and infrastructure. 7/

In 2017, I founded the @ASEANCaucus to strengthen US engagement with Southeast Asia.
 
The America COMPETES Act includes my bill w/ @RepTenney — ‘Young Southeast Asian Leadership Initiative Act,’ to strengthen people-to-people engagement with ASEAN through the @YSEALI program. 6/

The last thing the world needs is a nuclear arms race in the Middle East.
 
The America COMPETES Act includes language from @EdMarkey, @SenJeffMerkley, @RepTedLieu, and my ‘Saudi WMD Act,’ to counter Saudi Arabia's pursuit of ballistic missile & nuclear technology. 5/

Too often, the People's Republic of China has weaponized access to its market to censor discussion of human rights.
 
Too often, corporations willingly play along, prioritizing profits over free speech.

The America COMPETES Act includes @RepMeijer and my bill to combat this. 4/

The Indo-Pacific — from East Africa to California — is increasingly important for US diplomacy, development, and security.
 
This legislation includes my ‘Indian Ocean Region Strategic Review Act’ to strengthen cooperation with allies and partners in this critical region. 3/

Diplomacy must be at the core of our foreign policy.
 
The America COMPETES Act includes language from the bill @RepSaraJacobs and I introduced, the ‘Restoring U.S. Leadership in International Organizations Act of 2021,’ to strengthen our leadership at the United Nations. 2/

The America COMPETES Act strengthens our supply chains, lowers costs, and ensures that America can out-compete anyone.
 
Included in it are bills I authored that will reignite American diplomacy & leadership while responding to challenges faced abroad. 1/
https://t.co/3i4hOsXgdR

In Texas, Gov. Abbott and Republicans are actively making it harder to vote — particularly for Latino, Black, and other minority communities.

The House passed the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act. The Senate must do the same.

The Senate must end the filibuster and pass voting rights legislation.

The Administration must provide a clear plan of action on how they will overcome legal hurdles and shut down the ‘Remain in Mexico’ program.

The need for the US government to focus on building a more orderly, safe, and humane asylum system at the border is long overdue. 7/7

In addition to ‘Remain in Mexico’, the continued use of Title 42 —deemed unnecessary by dozens of public health officials — should end immediately. 

It’s disappointing that the Admin has reopened travel and tourism yet denies desperate people legal protections for asylum. 6/

To put it simply, the ‘Remain in Mexico’ program must end once and for all.

Nearly a year into this Democratic administration and there has not been enough progress to establish the United States as a leader of human rights for asylum seekers. 5/

As well as questions the legitimacy of President Biden’s campaign promise to terminate the Trump-era policy, which left tens of thousands asylum seekers in significant danger as they fled their home countries seeking protection in the United States. 4/

While I realize the Administration must comply with a conservative Supreme Court’s order, the Administration went beyond what the Court ordered and expanded the program.

This raises justifiable concerns regarding the treatment of people seeking asylum. 3/

What’s particularly concerning with the return of ‘Remain in Mexico’ is the expansion of the program to include all Western Hemisphere nations. It only applied to Spanish speakers. 

This puts non-Spanish speaking immigrants at a higher risk for violence & discrimination. 2/

I strongly disagree with the reinstatement of the ‘Remain in Mexico’ program, which contributed to a humanitarian crisis at the border. 

Those previously subjected to the program, including women and young children, were living in horrendous conditions for months on end. 1/ https://t.co/YMcfd00BJT
